physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 6 x 7 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Caption from photo book: ''The Shwayder Family celebrating the 80th birthday of Rachel Shwayder, seated center, at the Green Gables country Club, Denver, c. 1950. In 1910 Jesse Shwayder opened a small luggage factroy and with his brothers, Mark, Maurice, Benjamin, and Solomon, turned it into one of the largest luggage producers in America, the Samsonite Corporation. Leaders in Denver philanthropy, the Shwayder family took an especially active role in Rose Hospital, the University of Denver, the Denver Art Museum, the National Jewish Hospital, Temple Emanuel, and many other organizations. Courtesy: Mr. and Mrs. King Shwayder, Sponsor: Mr. and Mrs. King Shwayder.''

mods.abstract: The Shwayder family pose on a stairway at the Green Gables Country Club during Rachel Shwayder's 80th birthday celebration.
mods.note: Appears in Jeanne E. Abrams, Images of America: Jewish Denver, 1859-1940 (Charleston: Arcadia, 2007), 35.

titleInfo.title: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
